author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
'Twas the goat under mountain, eyes glistening like dawn,
As China hints of saving, the property sector yawn.
But like the snail cautious, investors query the tale,
For details still are missing, in the economic grail.

The dove, ever tranquil, ascends despite the slide,
Unilever plays the piper, while volume wanes worldwide.
Sweet cream of Ben & Jerry, sales leap above the spread,
Yet prices keep on climbing, a worry that widespread.

In Indonesia's heartland, where the patient rabbit bides,
The bank remains unaltered, as on its path it rides.
With Rupiah safe-spaces, and inflation straitly tamed,
Their stand is but expected, the policy unblamed.

feedItems.title: Metals Rise After China Hints at Property Sector Support
feedItems.description: Base metals gained on China’s planned new policies to support property developers, but ANZ said investors would require more details before they felt reassured about the economy.

feedItems.title: Dove Maker Unilever Still Raising Prices as Volumes Slip
feedItems.description: The consumer goods giant—which also makes Ben & Jerry’s ice cream—beat second-quarter sales growth expectations.

feedItems.title: Indonesia's Central Bank Stands Pat as Expected
feedItems.description: Bank Indonesia stood pat as expected during its July policy meeting to maintain the stability of the rupiah and ensure that inflation remains under control.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Upon the restless sea of trade, the oil doth pause it's dance,
The East, a beast of property, gives support a glance.
Yet broader aid, yearned by the hoard, is held in coy suspense,
Their hopes as fleeting as a ship lost in the ocean's expanse.

Now see the mighty Dollar falter, 'neath risk appetite's slight,
As traders hearken to the East, in the still and starlit night.
"Counter-cyclical" measures sworn by Politburo's might,
Yet uncertainty, like a lurking kraken, keeps markets in a fright.

Akzo of Nobel lineage, falls short of seers' guess,
Yet lifts its gaze towards fairer days, amidst the market's mess.
Earnings posted, coins counted, less than more, no less,
Yet uncertain times, like stormy climes, on their growth doth press.

feedItems.title: Oil Pauses Despite China Signaling Property Support
feedItems.description: Oil futures were little changed after China signaled it was considering support for the flagging property sector but stopped short of announcing the broader economic support investors were hoping for.

feedItems.title: Dollar Edges Lower on Tentative Risk Appetite Among Investors
feedItems.description: The dollar edged lower, dented by risk appetite among investors after promises from China’s Politburo of ‘counter-cyclical’ measures, ING said.

feedItems.title: Akzo Nobel Falls Short of Forecasts But Lifts Outlook
feedItems.description: Akzo Nobel posted adjusted earnings of €397 million but raised its full-year guidance despite ongoing economic uncertainties continuing to weigh on its volume growth.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In Spain, a brewer’s yeast doth rise,
From politick squabbles 'neath Iberian skies.
Yet strength of the purse keeps the brew aloft,
Else this cask of governance might taste somewhat soft.

Unilever, thy tankard overflows with gain,
No humble suds, but barrels full of rain.
Where sales did fall, your price did mount,
To keep your ale by God's own count.

And Alstom, thy barley be not hollow,
For your sales today promise ale tomorrow.
Keep thy fiscal outlook clear and bright,
Until 2026, when we'll drink in delight.

feedItems.title: Political Uncertainty Might Weigh On Spanish Bonds But Economy Helps
feedItems.description: Protracted coalition negotiations and possibly another election in the fourth quarter might still weigh on Spanish government bonds, but economic strength is likely to counter political uncertainty, Citi said.

feedItems.title: Unilever Lifts Guidance as Sales Growth Tops Views
feedItems.description: Unilever posted underlying sales growth of 7.9% for the second quarter, ahead of consensus forecasts, as price increases outweighed a slight decline in volumes, and it raised its full-year sales target.

feedItems.title: Alstom Sales Rise, Maintains Outlook
feedItems.description: Alstom posted a 4.3% rise in first-quarter sales and confirmed its fiscal 2024 outlook and 2026 targets.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In the realm called Nikkei, grief stirs the pot,
For Tech and Pharma shares have lost their lot.
Yet in every debacle, some reprieve is sought,
Finder's keep, in auto and bank shares they bought.

A warning from Sasol, the mariner at sea,
Of low tides in sales, predicted, in twenty twenty-three.
'Tis not a storm, but waves of instability,
As fiscal year of twenty four, dons a cloak of volatility.

Lo! Remy Cointreau, bearing tidings of a letdown fall,
Yet 'gainst adversity, stands steadfast and tall. 
Though U.S. desires have ceased to be enthral,
By the next fiscal year, they’ll meet their call.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.1%, Dragged by Tech, Pharma Stocks
feedItems.description: The Nikkei Stock Average ended 0.1% lower at 32682.51 as losses in tech and pharmaceutical stocks offset gains in auto and bank shares.

feedItems.title: Sasol Cautious on Outlook as Sales Fall
feedItems.description: Sasol reported lower chemical sales in 2023 of just under $9 billion and cautioned that it expected continued pricing and demand volatility in fiscal 2024.

feedItems.title: Remy Cointreau Outlook on Track Despite Sales Fall
feedItems.description: Remy Cointreau said sales for the first quarter fell to €258 million, down 35% on an organic basis, due to a continued normalization in U.S. consumption patterns but it remained confident of meeting its outlook for fiscal 2024.
